content: None of the test servers listed in Cross Organization Application Access track is working

I too am finding many of the servers down. During the physical connectathon days that was not uncommon as people would be shipping equipment to the physical event...(not many servers, but the pattern did happen). With virtual events it is not clear why a server might not be available. And even nicer if those operators would indicate their availability.
I think the list is quite old...
there have been some new entries... but even the likes of http://test.fhir.org have been down for days (not it is up).
Cerner's test server as documented here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/Test+Servers is one of those that is down - because we've updated our URL! How can I request access to edit that page?
you should be able to update the confluence page. @Sandra Vance can you please help Max edit his test server URL?
Hm, yeah, I just see 'Log in' but no options to edit, unless I've missed them
Can someone send me the URL for the Graeme server. I am having an issue with the AEGIS.net, Inc.

Are you looking for http://test.fhir.org/ ?
Also if you having problems with Touchstone please email Touchstone_Support@aegis.net with your issue so we can help you resolve it.

ryan moehrke said:

Are you looking for http://test.fhir.org/ ?
Also if you having problems with Touchstone please email Touchstone_Support@aegis.net with your issue so we can help you resolve it.
test.fhir.org seems to be down
@Grahame Grieve
coming back up

Hi @Grahame Grieve Is this the correct place to report a problem with http://hapi.fhir.org/baseR4/
?

Here is what we are seeing:

We are doing a conditional create of the Patient Resource inside a transaction bundle that also subsequently posts a Communication Resource which references that Patient as the subject and sender. The Transaction completes successfully but when I retrieve the Communication that was created, it has a "contained" Patient resource and the subject and sender are referencing the local contained Patient resource. This is not the behavior I was expecting to see. Do you know why this transaction is causing the Patient to be carried as a Contained Resource?
@James Agnew (though this would probably better raised on #hapi)
this should be on #hapi
Can you move my message to there? I don't see how to move it myself.
Nevermind. I can copy it
(deleted)
(deleted)
